doc.content:
Exploring Everyday Chemistry
Today's chemical to be introduced is "Cocaine Hydrochloride".
Cocaine Hydrochloride is dangerous, may be fatal if swallowed or inhaled.
Potential Health Effects:
Skin Contact: Numbness at area of contact will occur. The possibility of absorption under conditions of skin breakage or inflammation exists.
Eye Contact: Mild irritant. Can be absorbed from solution with dilating effect on the pupil.
Chronic Exposure: Can lead to habituation or addiction.
